Package org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode

Class RobotWheels

java.lang.Object
org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.RobotWheels
public class RobotWheels extends Object
This class contains only teamâ€™s wheel motor component resources. Use this class if your team is not using Pedro Pathing. Additionally, this class has convenience methods, such as autoDriveRobot() and manuallyDriveRobot(). Each OpMode then uses an instance of the single RobotWheels (if not using Pedro Pathing).

    class 
    RobotWheels.HeadingTelemetry
    Provides a convenient interface for setting and updating telemetry for robot movements during heading-driven events.

  • Method Details

    • init

      public void init()
      Call init() to initialize all the robot's hardware.

    • setRunModeForAllWheels

      public void setRunModeForAllWheels(com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.DcMotor.RunMode runMode)
      Set the RunMode for all wheel motors to the passed runMode.
      Parameters:
      runMode - DcMotor.RunMode

    • setPowerAllWheels

      public void setPowerAllWheels(double baseSpeed, double headingSpeedAdjustment)
      Adjust the baseSpeed by +/- headingSpeedAdjustment, then set power to the left and right wheels to those powers. Scale down both left and right motor speeds if either is > 1.0 or invalid input: '<' -1.0.
      Parameters:
      baseSpeed - - base speed of the motor to which headingSpeedAdjustment will be applied.
      headingSpeedAdjustment - - power adjustment applied to baseSpeed to turn the robot to the desiredHeading.

    • setPowerAllWheels

      public void setPowerAllWheels(double speed)
      Set the Power for all wheels to the passed speed.
      Parameters:
      speed - - power of the motor, a value in the interval [-1.0, 1.0]

    • manuallyDriveRobot

      public void manuallyDriveRobot(double stick1X, double stick1Y, double stick2X)
      Drive robot according to passed stick inputs.
      Parameters:
      stick1X - Value from stick 1's X axis
      stick1Y - Value from stick 1's Y axis
      stick2X - Value from stick 2's X axis

    • setDrivePower

      public void setDrivePower(double leftFrontPower, double rightFrontPower, double leftRearPower, double rightRearPower)
      Pass the requested wheel motor powers to the appropriate hardware drive motors.

    • autoDriveRobot

      public void autoDriveRobot(int leftInches, int rightInches, double speed)
      Drive robot to the targeted position designated by the passed leftInches and rightInches, at the power specified by speed.
      Parameters:
      leftInches - How far the left wheels should travel
      rightInches - How far the right wheels should travel
      speed - speed applied to all wheels

    • autoDriveRobot

      public void autoDriveRobot(int leftInches, int rightInches)
      autoDriveRobot using DEFAULT_WHEEL_MOTOR_SPEED.
      Parameters:
      leftInches - How far the left wheels should travel
      rightInches - How far the right wheels should travel

    • autoDriveRobotWithHeading

      public void autoDriveRobotWithHeading(int inches, double heading, double speed)
      Drive robot the targeted inches, at the passed heading, at the passed speed. Left and right wheel speeds are adjusted as necessary to get the robot on the passed heading.
      Parameters:
      inches - How far the robot should travel
      heading - Heading in yaw degree (+/- 180)
      speed - Speed to apply to all wheels

    • turnToHeading

      public void turnToHeading(double heading, double speed)
      Spin on the central axis to point in a new direction. Move will stop if either of these conditions occur: 1) Move gets to the heading (angle) 2) Driver stops the OpMode running.
      Parameters:
      heading - Absolute Heading Angle (in Degrees) relative to last gyro reset. If a relative angle is required, add/subtract from current heading.
      speed - Desired speed of turn. (range 0 to +speed)

    • getHeadingCorrection

      public double getHeadingCorrection(double desiredHeading, double gainFactor, double maxSpeed)
      Calculate a motor speed that can be used to turn the robot to the desiredHeading. Get the difference between the passed desiredHeading and the actual heading. Normalize the difference to be in terms of yaw (+/- 180 degrees). Multiply the difference by gainFactor to get a potential motor speed. Clip the potential motor speed to the maxSpeed.
      Parameters:
      desiredHeading - yaw degrees (+/- 180)
      gainFactor - factor to convert heading difference to a motor speed
      maxSpeed - maximum speed returned.
      Returns:
      motor speed in the range of -maxSpeed to maxSpeed.

    • driveToSpike

      public void driveToSpike(org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.SpikeColor color, int colorThreshold, double approachSpeed)
      Drive robot until the passed color is detected.
      Parameters:
      color -
      colorThreshold -

    • driveToSpike

      public void driveToSpike(org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.SpikeColor color, int colorThreshold)
      Drive robot until the passed color is detected, using DEFAULT_APPROACH_SPEED.
      Parameters:
      color -
      colorThreshold -
